title: No, a Roman statesman didn't warn Trump thousands of years ago.
text: An article on Facebook quotes from a Romanian public speaker and a statesman Cicero as "a thousand years old warning about TRUMP." The quote reads: "The nation can survive its stupid, even ambitious, idiots. But he can't survive betrayal from within. For the traitor, he does not seem a traitor - he speaks a language familiar to his victims, and he appeals for the sobriety that lies at the heart of all people. It rots the soul of a nation - it works secretly and anonymously at night to undermine the pillars of the city - and it infects the political body so that it can no longer resist. "The killer is less afraid of him." The words, with some slightly different repetitions, were widely attributed to Cicero over the Internet for some time, but we didn't find any evidence that he actually said or wrote them. (In addition, he died in 43 BC, a year before the Mimi claimed to have quoted him.)
